alert.note: Alert for Eastern Las Animas County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County; Lamar Vicinity, Prowers County; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Springfield Vicinity, Baca County; Trinidad Vicinity, Western Las Animas County Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Otero, southwestern Prowers, Baca, Las Animas and southern Bent Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 541 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms across the southeast plains of Colorado along two colliding boundaries. Storms are expected to increase in coverage and intensify. Heavy rainfall with rates of over 2 inches per hour will be possible, leading to potential flash flooding conditions. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flash flooding may be possible, especially over low-lying and flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Trinidad, Springfield, Pritchett, Vilas, Kim, Branson, Two Buttes, Delhi, Higbee, Hoehne, Tyrone, Trinchera, Two Buttes Reservoir, Model, Thatcher and Raton Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
